title: The downfall of the Denver Broncos after Peyton Manning
Are the St. Louis Blues an average hockey franchise
text:
The St. Louis Blues, the team that makes me sad. Yes, I updated this after losing in double OT to those goddamn Winnipeg Jets. Are they average? Some seasons they look strong, others not so much. 2025 was a similar story to the 2019 team, being out of the playoff picture and getting hot the second half of the season to make the playoffs. But, what about the St. Louis Blues over the past ten years?


Code
library(tidyverse)
library(ggplot2)
library(ggrepel)

STL <- read_csv("Blues1525.csv")

blues <- STL |> filter(Team == "St. Louis Blues")

la <- STL |> filter(Team == "League Average")

ggplot() +
  geom_line(data=blues, aes(x=Year, y=W), color="#002F87") +
  geom_line(data=la, aes(x=Year, y=W),color="black") +
  labs(
    x="Season",
    y="Wins",
    title="The St. Louis Blues were an above average team in wins for most of the past 10 years ",
    subtitle= "The blues finished with more wins than the league average every season except for the 2021 and 2023 seasons",
    caption="Source: www.hockey-reference.com | By Logan Kuker"
  )+
  theme_minimal()+
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=9.5), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 









Over the past decade, the St. Louis Blues have consistently performed as an above-average team in terms of regular season wins. They finished with more wins than the league average in every season since 2015 except for 2021 and 2023. Despite the dip in those two seasons, the Blues have been a competitive team in the NHL.


Code
blues |> 

ggplot() + 
  geom_point(
    data=la, 
    aes(x=GA, y=GF, size=W), 
    colour="black", 
    alpha=.3) + 
  geom_point(
    data=blues, 
    aes(x=GA, y=GF, size=W), 
    colour="#002F87") + 
  geom_text_repel(
    data=blues, 
    aes(x=GA, y=GF, label= Year)
  ) +
  labs(
    x="Goals Allowed",
    y="Goals For",
    title="The St. Louis Blues have solid defense and goalie play ",
    subtitle= "The blues are a pretty average team on offense but are generally above average in goals allowed due to their good goaltending.",
    caption="Source: www.hockey-reference.com | By Logan Kuker"
  )+
  theme_minimal()+
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 15, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=8), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 









One thing that St. Louis has become known for is reliable goaltending. While their offensive output tends to hover around the league average, their strength is limiting goals against. The Blues have generally ranked above average in goals allowed and allows them to make the playoffs.


Code
ggplot() + 
  geom_bar(data=blues, aes(x=reorder(Year, PTS), weight=PTS),fill="#002F87") +
  geom_bar(data=la, aes(x=reorder(Year, PTS), weight=PTS), fill="black") +
  coord_flip() +
  geom_text(aes(x=11, y=40, label="League Average"), color="white") +
  geom_text(aes(x=11, y=100, label="STL"), color="#FCB514") +  
  geom_text(aes(x=10, y= 40, label="League Average"), color="white")+
  geom_text(aes(x=9, y= 40, label="League Average"), color="white")+
  geom_text(aes(x=8, y= 40, label="League Average"), color="white")+
  geom_text(aes(x=7, y= 40, label="League Average"), color="white")+
  geom_text(aes(x=6, y= 40, label="League Average"), color="white")+
  geom_text(aes(x=5, y= 40, label="League Average"), color="white")+
  geom_text(aes(x=4, y= 40, label="League Average"), color="white")+
  geom_text(aes(x=3, y= 40, label="League Average"), color="white")+
  geom_text(aes(x=2, y= 40, label="League Average"), color="white")+
  geom_text(aes(x=1, y= 30, label="League Average"), color="white")+
  geom_text(aes(x=10, y=100, label="STL"), color="#FCB514")+
  geom_text(aes(x=9, y=100, label="STL"), color="#FCB514")+
  geom_text(aes(x=8, y=95, label="STL"), color="#FCB514")+
  geom_text(aes(x=7, y=95.5, label="STL"), color="#FCB514")+
  geom_text(aes(x=5, y=86, label="STL"), color="#FCB514")+
  labs(
    x="Season", 
    y="Points", 
    title="The St. Louis Blues have consistently produced seasons with points above average", 
    subtitle="St. Louis is good at gaining enough points throughout the season to be above average and make the playoffs.", 
    caption="Source: www.hockey-reference.com | By Logan Kuker")+
  theme_minimal() + 
  theme(
    plot.title = element_text(size = 12, face = "bold"),
    axis.title = element_text(size = 8), 
    plot.subtitle = element_text(size=10), 
    panel.grid.minor = element_blank(),
    plot.title.position = "plot"
    ) 









The St. Louis Blues have consistently delivered regular seasons with point totals above the league average. Even in seasons where their offense doesn’t stand out, the Blues find ways to get wins and secure points.
